series.title: Come Together
series.description:
God didn’t create us to go through life alone. We’re designed for deep, satisfying, life-shaping relationships with other people. Yet loneliness – the absence of those kinds of relationships – has been described as “the American epidemic.” It leads us to ask, what is true community, and how do we find it?

In the most personal of his letters, the apostle Paul helps us understand how to develop authentic, meaningful relationships with each other... relationships that foster spiritual growth and purposeful living. Not just how to find true community, but how to come together and build it.

Join us this fall for our Come Together teaching series. Each Sunday we’ll look at some of the ways we can all live in true community at church, and in our wider world.

sermons.title: Coming Together In Times Of Struggle

series.title: One Word Prayers
series.description:
When it comes to prayer, it's easy to think longer is better. We measure the value of prayer by the time we take to express the thoughts in our mind, the feelings on our heart. It's easy to measure prayer in quantity, not quality.

But what about the times we use just one word? An outburst of joy, an exhale of relief, a snap of frustration, a simple utterance of sheer wonder... are those prayers too?

Join us on Sundays this summer for our One Word Prayers teaching series, as we gain a deeper understanding of prayer in our everyday lives. Because not all prayers start with, 'Dear Heavenly Father…'

series.title: With God: I Want My Life Back
series.description: John starts off a new sub series this Easter called, "I Want My Life Back" looking at how we can reclaim our lives again through the hope of the resurrection.

series.title: With God: I Want My Life Back

series.title: With God: I Want My Life Back

sermons.title: What's Better Than the Happy Life?
sermons.description: Our senior pastor John Ortberg kicked off a new series, The Search for Happy. Everyone is looking for "Happy," but what is it we're really looking for, and how do we find it?

series.title: Search For Happy
series.description:
Life is so constructed that the event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation. - Charlotte Bronte

Everyone is searching for happiness. But what does it look like and how do we know when we've found it?

Join us for this series as we look at the book of Philippians and journey together on the search for happy..

sermons.title: Four Ways to Make Your Life Miserable
sermons.description: Last weekend, our senior pastor John Ortberg continues the series, "The Search for Happy," with a message on how we can be joyful no matter what our circumstances are like because joy is not a feeling of happiness based on what happens but because it is the only rational response to the resurrection of the Redeemer.

series.title: Search For Happy

Join us for this series as we look at the book of Philippians and journey together on the search for happy..

sermons.title: The Shocking Secret Happy People Learn
sermons.description: Our Senior Pastor John Ortberg continues the series, "The Search for Happy," with a message on the common misunderstanding that we'd find joy in achieving status and at the top of the social ladder but that it's found as we descend with Christ to the bottom at the Cross.
